column4: how can I get ubuntu to recognize my keyboard?? It's not USB, just regular PS\2. I've already tried other keyboards.
PS/2 keyboards should be recogniced by the kernel
Yep, but how do I get around it_
found anything in bios that points to keyboard USB being on?
if it is, disable it and try again
Yep, but I disabled it. Just in case, but it still won't recognize the keyboard.
Nope, no other keyboards are recognized, I don't have a USB keyboard to test with either..
sounds like the ps/2 is damaged
Why does it work for configuring the bios and whatnot.
try reseting the bios to default settings
I started diabling crap and the keyboard started to work.. I'm gonna start turning things on again in stages to see where it get hung up...
It turned out to be the GATE20A option in the BIOS...
My keyboard is working fine now!!! YEAh!!!!
